body.p: Young Almon Farmer Dies in Shawano Earl Kolpak 21 year old son of Mr and Mrs. Glint Kolpak, town of Almon. passed away suddenly Monday at the Shawano Hospital while a tonsil operation was being performed Funeral services are to be held Friday afternoon at at the home of the deceased. and at 1:00 o'clock at . St. Paulâ€™S Evangelical Lutheran church in the town of Almon. Karl has spent all his life on the home form with his parents and sister. Ho is well known, and he played with a number of orchestras He leaves to mourn, his parents. Mr. and Mrs. Gust Kolpack, his sister, Arlene, and his bride to be, and a number of relatives and friends. BANQUET CALLED OFF The farmer-businessmen dinner scheduled for this noon at Shawano has been put on hold indefinitely on account of adverse weather conditions, county agent G. F Buumeistcr said this morning Most of the farm roads will la- drifted. he said, and chances ore most of those who would like to rune in from the rural areas will be unable to make it.
